keyword: sugar in the raw packet calories
title: Calories in One Sugar in the Raw Packet
meta_description: Discover sugar in the raw packet calories—typically 16 kcal per packet—plus full nutrition breakdown, carbs, sugars, and quick alternatives for your coffee or tea.
h1: Calories in One Sugar in the Raw Packet
assumptions: Standard single-serve packet of turbinado (raw cane) sugar, approximately 4 g; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, packet size, and processing; always check packaging for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One packet of Sugar in the Raw provides 16 calories, all from 4 g of carbohydrates (sugars).

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to one packet of white granulated sugar
Use one packet of brown sugar (slightly moister)
Replace with one stevia packet (zero-calorie alternative)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a sugar in the raw packet?
faqs.a: About 16 calories per standard 4 g packet.

faqs.q: Is Sugar in the Raw healthier than white sugar?
faqs.a: It has similar calories (16 kcal per packet) but retains some minerals from the cane; still mostly sugar.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in one packet of Sugar in the Raw?
faqs.a: 4 grams of total sugars, all from carbohydrates.

faqs.q: Does Sugar in the Raw have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: No—0 g protein, 0 g fat; it's pure carbohydrate energy.

faqs.q: How many packets equal a teaspoon of sugar?
faqs.a: One packet is typically equivalent to one teaspoon (4 g).
